intro: Oliveriana luerorum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 cm and thrives in warm, humid environments. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, white, and yellow, making it a popular ornamental plant. Oliveriana luerorum requires well-draining soil and indirect sunlight to flourish.
